Retrieve a Specific Field from the Specified or All Environments

Source: R/file-handling_int.R
dot-fh_environment_value_get.Rd

This internal helper function extracts a user-specified field (e.g., "name", "root") from environment entries in the configuration. You can optionally provide an environment name (.envr) to retrieve the field from only that environment.

Usage

.fh_environment_value_get(.key, .envr = NULL, .config = .hl_config_get())

Arguments

.key

A character string specifying the name of the field to retrieve from each environment entry (e.g., "name" or "root").

.envr

An optional character string specifying a single environment name (e.g., "production", "development"). If NULL (default), the function returns values for all environments.

.config

A list or environment containing the loaded configuration. Defaults to .hl_config_get(), an internal function assumed to provide the YAML or config object.

Value

A character vector containing the requested field's value for the matching environments. If .envr is NULL, this includes all environments. If no environments match .envr, the function returns an empty character vector.

Details

The function first accesses the top-level environments key in the configuration, which should be a list of environment entries, each containing at least one field named according to .key. It filters the list by .envr (if specified), then uses vapply to extract that field from each matching environment, returning the results as a character vector.

If environments is missing or empty, the function raises an error.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  # Suppose your YAML has:
  # environments:
  #   - name: development
  #     root: 'OneDriveConsumer/.../development'
  #   - name: production
  #     root: 'OneDriveConsumer/.../production'

  # retrieving environment names for all environments
  env_names <- .fh_environment_value_get(.key = "name")
  print(env_names)
  # e.g. c("development", "production")

  # retrieving the root path for only the 'production' environment
  prod_root <- .fh_environment_value_get(.key = "root", .envr = "production")
  print(prod_root)
  # e.g. "OneDriveConsumer/.../production"
} # }
